ruling_link_text: This gag order must have stayed mum
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says GOP banned mention of Ayers in '08
statement: "I was banned from talking about" Bill Ayers during the 2008 presidential campaign.

ruling_link_text: It's a well-off capital
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says D.C. is home to 7 of 10 of the highest-income counties
statement: "Seven of the 10 highest-income counties in the country ring the city" of Washington D.C.

ruling_link_text: He said it, in one interview
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says Barack Obama once said the individual mandate "wasn't a tax"
statement: Obama "said (the individual mandate) wasn't a tax."

ruling_link_text: Where's the beef on this claim?
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says price of Slim Jims has risen 169 percent recently
statement: Slim Jims "just recently" cost 99 cents but now cost $2.69.

ruling_link_text: "Warning" came after Revere was captured by British
ruling_headline: Was trash-talking the British part of Paul Revere's ride?
statement: "Part of his ride was to warn the British that were already there that, 'Hey, you're not going to succeed.' "

ruling_link_text: Math doesn't add up
ruling_headline: Palin claims loss of oil production in Gulf of Mexico will cost $8 billion a day in imports
statement: "We're going to be looking at $8 billion a day that we're going to be pouring into foreign countries in order to import that make-up fuel that we're going to need to take the place of what we could have gotten out of the gulf."

ruling_link_text: Natural decline more of a factor than moratorium
ruling_headline: Palin claims Gulf of Mexico drilling moratorium will cause projected 150,000 barrel a day production drop
statement: We are looking at "150,000 barrels (of oil) per day less next year, and 200,000 barrels per day less being able to be developed from the gulf the year after" because of the moratorium on new drilling enacted by the Obama administration.

ruling_link_text: Under Obama, debt has piled up, but not that much
statement_context: an interview with Fox News' Greta Van Susteren
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says Obama has accumulated more debt than previous 43 presidents combined
statement: "Look at the debt that has been accumulated in the last two years. It's more debt under this president than all those other presidents combined."

ruling_link_text: Palin defends herself accurately
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin said "violence isn't the answer" at a March campaign rally
statement: Says she condemned violence at a campaign stop in Arizona in March.

ruling_link_text: Palin's tweet forgets tax cut history
ruling_headline: 'Obama tax hikes'? Just as easily call them the Bush tax hikes.
statement: "Pls refer to Jan.1 tax changes appropriately: they're OBAMA TAX HIKES & they'll slam every American's savings, investments & job opportunity"

ruling_link_text: Palin's wrong, but we see why she thought what she did
ruling_headline: Who's right on food inflation: Sarah Palin or the Wall Street Journal?
statement: Grocery prices "have risen significantly over the past year or so."

ruling_link_text: See page 39 in 2011 budget
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin said Democrats have no plan to extend some of the Bush tax cuts
statement: Democrats do not have a plan for extending the Bush tax cuts.

ruling_link_text: Reagan raised taxes higher than the real Dem plan
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin said Democrats are planning "the largest tax increase in U.S. history"
statement: "Democrats are poised now to cause this largest tax increase in U.S. history."

ruling_link_text: If you use a table that includes Maldives, Burundi, Swaziland...
ruling_headline: Palin says U.S. ranks 25th in defense spending ranking
statement: The U.S. "only ranks 25th worldwide on defense spending as a percentage of GDP."

ruling_link_text: She gets it right
ruling_headline: Palin says U.S. spends three times more on entitlements and debt service than on defense
statement: "We spend three times more on entitlements and debt services than we do on defense."

ruling_link_text: A well-established number that's often described incorrectly
statement_context: a speech at a Tea Party rally in Boston
ruling_headline: Palin says Americans spend 100 days paying off their tax burden
statement: "Americans now spend 100 days out of the year working for government before we even start working for ourselves."

ruling_link_text: Chinese wind turbine companies? Not so much.
ruling_headline: Palin claims that most of the renewable energy stimulus dollars have gone to Chinese turbinemakers
statement: "We were promised (the stimulus) would provide 'green jobs' for Americans, but 80% of the $2 billion they spent on alternative energy went to purchase wind turbines built in China!"

ruling_link_text: Open government behind closed doors?
statement_context: a speech to members of the Tea Party
ruling_headline: Palin claims Biden held a transparency board meeting behind closed doors
statement: Vice President Joe Biden's meeting "with the transparency and accountability board . . . was closed to the public."

ruling_link_text: Signs advertising stimulus, yes; $1 million, probably not
statement_context: an address at the Tea Party convention
ruling_headline: Palin claims a state paid $1 million to advertise that they were spending stimulus money
statement: "One state even spent a million bucks to put up signs that advertise that they were spending on the federal stimulus projects."

ruling_link_text: Wrong on a couple of counts
ruling_headline: Palin says Obama voted "present" in U.S. Senate "quite often"
statement: "Barack Obama had 150 days in the U.S. Senate where he was able to vote quite often 'present.' "

ruling_link_text: Emerging economies don't have absolute reductions
ruling_headline: Proposals allow emerging economies more carbon emissions
statement: "President Obama's proposal calls for serious cuts in our own long-term carbon emissions," but China and India will still be allowed to increase their emissions.

ruling_link_text: By most measures, current one is worse
ruling_headline: Palin claims Reagan faced a worse recession than Obama
statement: "Ronald Reagan faced an even worse recession" than the current one.

ruling_link_text: Press releases, Web ads, conference calls, debate jabs . . .
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin claims the campaign did not elaborate on Obama's association with ACORN
statement: The McCain campaign "did not elaborate" on Obama's ties to ACORN.

ruling_link_text: Current proposal would reduce impact on the poor
ruling_headline: Democratic cap and trade plans have credits to offset electricity rate increases
statement: A cap-and-trade plan promoted by Barack Obama would hit hardest "those already struggling to make ends meet."

ruling_link_text: He said in '08
ruling_headline: Obama said cap and trade would increase electricity rates
statement: Obama has admitted a cap and trade plan would cause electricity bills to "skyrocket."

ruling_link_text: Universal building codes not required
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin claims weatherization money in stimulus required universal building codes
statement: Says she couldn't take stimulus money because it required "universal building codes."

ruling_link_text: Many will not pay the full amount
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says health care reform will be costly
statement: Under the House health care bill, the government "will have to penalize citizens if we choose not to buy a plan that will cost a minimum of about $15,000 per family per year."

ruling_link_text: CEOs aren't the only ones with 'Cadillac' plans
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says health care reform will raise taxes on the middle class
statement: The proposed excise tax on "Cadillac" health plans will hit "those making less than $200,000" the hardest.

ruling_link_text: She's in the ballpark
statement_context: a speech to investors in Hong Kong
ruling_headline: Palin says defense spending was tiny portion of stimulus
statement: "The Defense Department received only one-half of 1 percent of the nearly trillion-dollar stimulus package funding."

ruling_link_text: If you don't have to do it, it's voluntary
ruling_headline: Palin claims Obama misled when he said end-of-life counseling is voluntary
statement: A provision in the health care reform bill for end-of-life counseling for seniors is not "entirely voluntary."

ruling_link_text: Sci-fi scenario not based in reality
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin falsely claims Barack Obama runs a 'death panel'
statement: Seniors and the disabled "will have to stand in front of Obama's 'death panel' so his bureaucrats can decide, based on a subjective judgment of their 'level of productivity in society,' whether they are worthy of health care."

ruling_link_text: Palin's got an on again, off again relationship with cap-and-trade
ruling_headline: Palin flips on her support of cap-and-trade
statement: On a cap-and-trade plan.

ruling_link_text: Workers will get help - and maybe a new job, too
statement_context: an op-ed article in the Washington Post.
ruling_headline: Palin claims that the cap-and-trade bill includes a $4.2 billion worker program
statement: "Job losses are so certain under this new cap-and-tax plan that it includes a provision accommodating newly unemployed workers from the resulting dried-up energy sector, to the tune of $4.2 billion over eight years. So much for creating jobs."

ruling_link_text: Palin manufactures a fight
statement_context: an interview with Sean Hannity on Fox
ruling_headline: Sarah Palin says she vetoed stimulus money for energy efficiency because it required tougher building codes
statement: Palin said stimulus money for weatherization required "universal energy building codes for Alaska, kind of a one-size-fits-all building code that isn't going to work up there in Alaska."

ruling_link_text: "Precisely zero" is imprecise, at best
statement_context: an episode of her MSNBC show
ruling_headline: Maddow claims Palin got zero support for her idea, only it wasn't hers, and others supported it
statement: Gov. Sarah Palin "got precisely zero support for her call for Alaska's Democratic Senator Mark Begich to resign because Ted Stevens' corruption conviction was overturned."

ruling_link_text: No to Obama's stimulus; not to tax cuts
ruling_headline: Republicans opposed Obama's stimulus but not tax cuts
statement: Republican leaders said "no" to "tax cuts for 95% of working Americans."

ruling_link_text: The McCain campaign experiments with dishonesty
ruling_headline: The McCain campaign experiments with dishonesty
statement: Obama would "experiment with socialism."

ruling_link_text: Report finds Palin violated ethics laws
ruling_headline: Report finds Palin violated ethics laws
statement: "The truth was revealed there in that report that showed there was no unlawful or unethical activity on my part."

ruling_link_text: Obama and Ayers, Round II
ruling_headline: Obama and Ayers, Round II
statement: "Obama held one of the first meetings of his political career in Bill Ayers's home. And they've worked together on various projects in Chicago."

ruling_link_text: Palin exaggerates status, cost of pipeline
ruling_headline: Palin exaggerates status, cost of pipeline
statement: "We're building a nearly $40-billion natural gas pipeline, which is North America's largest and most expensive infrastructure project ever."

ruling_link_text: McCain and Biden agree on military matters? Barely, not adamantly
ruling_headline: McCain and Biden agree on military matters? Barely, not adamantly
statement: "You had supported John McCain's military strategies pretty adamantly until this race."

ruling_link_text: Property taxes rates went down, sales tax up
ruling_headline: Property taxes rates went down, sales tax up
statement: "As mayor, every year I was in office I did reduce taxes."

ruling_link_text: Yup, Obama votes with the D's
ruling_headline: Yup, Obama votes with the D's
statement: "Barack Obama ... 96 percent of his votes have been solely along party line."

ruling_link_text: Obama's plan does not call for government-run health care
ruling_headline: Obama's plan does not call for government-run health care
statement: Barack Obama's health care plan is "to mandate health care coverage and have a universal government-run program."

ruling_link_text: Biden's words haunt him
ruling_headline: Biden's words haunt him
statement: "You ... said that Barack Obama was not ready to be commander in chief."

ruling_link_text: Iran ain't Miami Beach, but beatings and killings for immodesty? No
ruling_headline: Iran ain't Miami Beach, but beatings and killings for immodesty? No
statement: "If an Iranian woman shows too much hair in public, she risks being beaten or killed."

ruling_link_text: There is no agreement to build, and it's not $40-billion
ruling_headline: There is no agreement to build, and it's not $40-billion

ruling_link_text: Not quite the largest, and not quite "brought about"
ruling_headline: Not quite the largest, and not quite "brought about"

ruling_link_text: Not far from Lincoln's sentiment
ruling_headline: Not far from Lincoln's sentiment

ruling_headline: Earlier, she didn't "attribute it to being man-made"
statement: On whether global warming is man-made.

ruling_link_text: She killed it, but it was nearly dead

ruling_headline: Palin sought more taxes and more development from oil companies

ruling_link_text: As candidate, yes; as governor, no
ruling_headline: As candidate, yes; as governor, no

ruling_link_text: Yes, 2,000 acres, but spread all over
ruling_headline: Yes, 2,000 acres, but spread all over

ruling_link_text: Each Alaskan got $1,200
